intro: Piriqueta caroliniana var. glabra, commonly known as the smooth piriqueta, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its smooth, hairless leaves. The plant produces small, clustered white or pale pink flowers that bloom in the summer months. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystem.
